result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County. Sentence credit of 4 days if revoked.

AS OF 10-25-2017: Court discharges the Defendant from Probation.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed/sign releases.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  NOTE: Court acknowledges that Defendant was 25 years of age at date/time of  offense.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with Woodman's in Menomonee Falls.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet previously done.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED- to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision - Early
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order For Early Termination of Probation, signed and filed.

Defendant John R Anderson in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the issue of expungement.  Court denies the expungement request because of the defendant's age at the time of the offense. Court grants the defendants request for an early discharge from probation.  Court discharges the defendant from Probation.
Review hearing on October 25, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John R Anderson in court with Probation Officer, Kim Copeskey.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes statements indicates that defendant is not elligible for expungement due to his age at the time of the offense.  Kim Copesky makes statements.  Court takes this issue underadvisement.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on October 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on September 27, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on September 27, 2017 at 09:30 am.
State's Objection to DOC Early Discharge Recommendation dated 8-29-17
from the Court to Assistant District Attorney Brian Bayer
Probation early discharge recommendation filed by the Dept of Corrections, dated 7-25-17.  ** Reviewed by Judge Lazar on 8-14-17**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John R Anderson in court with Attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Balistreri makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS  (4 Days credit, if revoked)   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  Woodman's in Menomonee Falls
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($200.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**  NOTE:  Court acknowledges that Defendant was 25 years of age at date/time of offense
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Both parties agree to an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Court addresses WCS letter/report filed today.  Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 10:30 am. Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.   Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program today.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  NOTE:  This is in addition to $2,000.00 signature bond already in place.

Defendant John R Anderson in court with Attorney Christina E. Balistreri.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Balistreri states that she is missing page 4 of doctor's report.  State states they are missing such page as well.  Court provides copy of page 4 to both parties from court's copy.  Defense is not contesting doctor's findings and is not requesting a hearing.  Attorney Balistreri states she will be filing a motion.  Court orders her to file such motion by 7/17/15.  Court sets jury status and jury trial date.   Court addresses WCS letters.  Court modifies/increases bail.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
